name: Silent Hunter® III
description: The king of submarine simulations returns with an all-new 3D engine, new crew command features, and more realistic WWII naval action than ever before. The movie-like graphics and simple, tension-filled gameplay make this the perfect game for the realism fanatic and the casual gamer.

reviews.review_text: This game reminds me of the movie 'Das Boot'. It is a remarkable experience to play.  You would never dream putting on a pair of headphones and listening for hours on end to white noise while staring at a static screen could be fun. And the first time doing this I remember thinking 'I really made a big mistake buying this game'.  Until... there! There's a ship out there at such and such a bearing! Let's go find out what it is!  Silent Hunter III goes through the full emotional experience of extreme boredom and painstaking listenning - it's an almost Zen-like meditative state. All the way to the intensity of hitting that torpedo fire button and knowing all hell is about to break loose. Watching a ship sink and patrols on their way to take you out. And then getting a destroyer to unload depth charges and praying your sorry ♥♥♥ you'll live through it all.  If that isn't enough - there are enemy airplanes out patroling.  Recommended.

Legit review time.  Pros - Open world - Loads of upgrades/new u-boats - Nice balance between relaxing sail trips and planning/executing your attack - Large and helpfull community  - loads of mods(some large enough to be concidered complete overhauls) - free to do as you please  - Can add own music to the gamophone (add the .mp3 to the gramophome folder in the installfolder) - Easy to get in to, but plenty of room to increase difficulty (i.e. disableling auto targeting, dud torpedoes and unlimited fuel/O2  Cons - one loading screen 3mins+ (very annoying if you need to re-load in a short amount of time) - most upgrades are late in the war (last 2 years) - Has an abrubt ending ( may 1945, will not be able to dock or set sail, and cant revieuw history) - In the late game its nearly impossible to get away from enemy warships (due to better sonar tech)

October 4, 1940 My U-boat, U-105, is chasing down a radio contact of a large convoy in the area. The seas buck like an untamed bronco and the fog thick as pea soup. We run on the surface to catch up with the convoy, when suddenly... 'Contact! Merchant, close.' close? how close?... oh. *waves to the sailors on the ship's deck* ok too close DIVEDIVEDIVE!!! The small cargo ship must have radioed our position (kinda hard to miss when we're literally spitting distance off their prow), for a destroyer was bearing down on us no more than ten minutes later. We were only at periscope depth when the destroyer passed overhead, scraping our boat in the process. It circled around, beginning its sweep. ping.... ping..... Ping. Ping. Ping. 'Depth charges in the water, sir!' you know the drill ahead flank bearing 27- BAM! BAM! BAM! ♥♥♥♥. aft torpedo and diesel engine rooms are flooding. double ♥♥♥♥. I've had issues with scrapes in the past, so I had the forsight of bringing a repair officer before leaving port. As he led the repair efforts, our bow raised 45 degrees as we began to descend uncontrollably. 30 meters. 50 meters. it'll take ~3 minutes to stop the flooding 75 meters. we're sinking faster 100 meters. 150 meters. 'We're reaching critical depth, sir!' 200 meters. c'mon guys, don't let me down... 250 meters. 'We can't go any deeper, sir!' 315 meters. flooding stopped! 310 meters. oh thank god, we're ascending... 300 meters. crack. crunch. psssssshhhhhh.... FFFFFFWWWWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOSSSSSSSSHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!! . . . . The Atlantic claimed 51 lives that evening, and the convoy continued untouched. (This real moment of intensity, terror, hope, and despair are brought to you by Ubisoft's Silent Hunter III and the Grey Wolves Gold mod pack, aka GWX Gold) Hopefully I'll learn from this experience (probably not) and have better luck on my next campaign. Good hunting!

Why are you reading this? What.... you haven't bought one of the best games of all time? Please.... you're kidding me? Right?   Probably one of the greatest, if not amazing and outstounding games to ever surface (pardon the sub-themed pun there).  Don't be deceived by the cheap, Disk version like i was, absolute piece of rubbish, and will only work on the recommended OS's on the back of the case- Some hooky software programs within the instalation process prevent it from working.  That aside, the Steam version tops the charts, easy install and easy to use. Only 2 main problems (which you MIGHT) come across, with easy resolutions: - If a message, on startup, pops up saying something about failed run, or cannot run e.t.c 3D graphics (something related like that), just simply alter your screen resolution to the notch down (right click on desktop, screen resolution) simple! - If you're installing GWX, then make sure it goes to the Silent Hunter 3 Steam folder, and not the make-believe, Disk-domain 'Ubisoft folder'.     On the note of GWX, GWX Gold is highly recommended, fixes most, if not all, the bugs. Adds in more realsim and greater weather and weather-fixes, as well as more sounds, subs, ships and skin-packs for new campaignes and designs.    Easily deserves a 100 on the Metascore, and definitely a 15 out of 10 for me.   In 2 words: Simply outstanding!

The king of submarine simulations returns with an all-new 3D engine, new crew command features, and more realistic WWII naval action than ever before. The movie-like graphics and simple, tension-filled gameplay make this the perfect game for the realism fanatic and the casual gamer.

When it comes to World War II submarine games, you'll not find one better than this. Whereas the rest of the Silent Hunter games generally fall flat on their faces, this one is well-made and very authentic. If you like tense simulation games that will require a whole lot of thinking and careful maneuvering, then this game will be a great fit for you.  Note, however, that the very authenticity of the game makes for a high learning curve. It'll take you some time to become accustomed to the game. Though becoming skilled at the gameplay is quite rewarding, be prepared for some time spent learning the game before you'll become effective at it. If you're looking for a game that won't require much time expenditure, this might not be the game for you.  All in all, this is a niche title. I don't recommend it.
